critique: This document establishes a commission to study and improve the United States' performance in the Olympic Games. It aims to address fragmentation and improve financial support for amateur athletes. There's no direct indication of a liberal or conservative ideology. It doesn't touch on immigration. It expands executive power slightly by creating a commission. It involves the federal government in sports, which could be seen as a slight move towards federal control. It doesn't directly address national security or civil liberties. It could be seen as a slight intervention in the economy by directing funds towards sports. It doesn't directly address social inclusion.
